In the imperial era, it is called the ninth generation of translators and the sixth translation. This is the fifth translation. As for the nine generations, they are the Later Han Dynasty. One, Han; two, Wei Cao; three, Jin; four, Song; five, Qi; six, Liang; seven, Zhou; eight, Sui Yang; nine, Tang Li. As for the change of times, it is a hundred thousand years and a single change in customs.

As listed above, the second is to clarify the ancient and modern prefaces. The major section is divided into two.
The preface section first clarifies the modern preface. It is divided into two parts. The first is the sequence of the teaching's rise. It is divided into three parts.
